contextId.information: Here Paul speaks of the Christian witness produced by the Thessalonian believers as if it were a bell that was rung or a musical instrument that was being played. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The word "hearts" is a metaphor for a person's desires and thoughts. AT: "who knows our desires and thoughts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul refers to the gospel message as if it were a physical object that one can share with others. By "sharing," he means "telling" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: We were pleased to share with you not only the gospel of God

contextId.information: Paul refers to his and his colleagues' lives as if they were physical objects that they could share with others. Here he means spending time and effort with his audience. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: We were pleased to share with you ... our own lives

contextId.information: Paul speaks as though someone can fill a container with their own sins as with liquid. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: they always fill up their own sins

contextId.information: Paul speaks as if he wants God to show him and his companions the route to take to visit the Thessalonian Christians. He means that he wants God to make it possible for them to do so. (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul refers to the "heart" as the center of one's beliefs and convictions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "walk" is an expression for the way one is to live. AT: "you ought to live"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul uses the word "quietly" as a metaphor to describe living at peace in one's community and not causing strife. AT: "live in a calm and orderly way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is a metaphor for living a productive life. AT: "work at your own jobs to earn what you need to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of evil and ignorance about God as if they were darkness. AT: "you are not unknowing, like people who live in the dark" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul speaks of the truth as if it were light and day. AT: "For you know the truth, like people who live in the light, like people during the day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: For you are all sons of the light and sons of the day

contextId.information: Paul speaks of spiritual unawareness as if it were sleep. AT: "let us not be like others who are not aware of Jesus coming back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: let us not sleep as the rest do

contextId.information: Paul describes spiritual awareness as the opposite of sleep and drunkenness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Just as when people sleep and do not know what is happening, so the people of this world do not know that Christ will return. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: For those who sleep do so at night

contextId.information: Paul speaks of knowing the truth about God as belonging to the day. AT: "we know the truth" or "we have received the light of truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

As a soldier would put on a breastplate to protect his body, a believer who lives by faith and love will find protection. AT: "protect ourselves with faith and love" or "protect ourselves by trusting Christ and loving him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: put on faith and love as a breastplate

contextId.information: Paul speaks of messages from the Holy Spirit as if they were objects that one could grasp in his hands. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Hold on to what is good
